intro: Maytenus neblinae, commonly known as the misty mayten, is a species of flowering plant native to the cloud forests of Central America. It is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, clustered flowers that bloom in white or pale yellow. The plant thrives in humid, shaded environments and is adapted to the high altitude and cool temperatures of its natural habitat. Its leaves are typically ovate or elliptic, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Maytenus neblinae plays an important ecological role in its ecosystem, providing habitat and food for various insects and birds.
